{"step_by_step_thinking": "In HIV positive patients, the most common fungal infection of the eye is usually caused by Candida. Aspergillus is a common fungal infection but it is not typically associated with eye infections in HIV positive patients. Toxoplasma is a parasitic infection and not a fungal infection. Rhinosporidium is a rare fungal infection that primarily affects the nose and nasopharynx, not the eye.", "answer_choice": "B. Candida"}
